intro: Ulleria surinamensis, commonly known as the Surinam bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Ulleria surinamensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
